verb.description: Be of the same opinion; agree.
examples: the authors concurred with the majority
they concurred in the creation of the disciplinary procedures

verb.description: Happen or occur at the same time; coincide.
examples: in tests, cytogenetic determination has been found to concur with enzymatic determination

origin: Late Middle English (also in the senses collide and act in combination): from Latin concurrere run together, assemble in crowds, from con- together with + currere to run.
